Reviews.Title: “Family Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica M
Reviews.Content: My family of four recently stayed at the Country Inn and had a wonderful time. It is centrally located between the zoo and sea world, each place was only a 20 minute drive. The rooms were clean and spacious given my children room to play. What my family enjoyed the most was the breakfast service. The staff was very kind and helpful, but one young man stood out from the rest. A young breakfast attend named Andrew was very polite and kind to my family. He's good manners help set this hotel apart from the rest. We really appreciated the manner that we we're treated throughout our stay. We'll be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “High End Country Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: themomof2inil
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many Country Inn & Suites before. When planning our first time trip to San Diego we had no idea where to stay, but we knew what we would get with a Country Inn & Suites so we chose it. We would rank this Country Inn & Suites above and beyond what their normal hotels are like (which are very nice). This hotel felt luxurious, extremely well kept, the staff was very pleasant, helpful and welcoming, and the breakfast area was big in size and had a wonderful selection. The room was also top notch with all the upgrades. The hotel is not downtown, but its location is very easy to hop on the interstate and within 10-15 minutes you can be downtown or to La Jolla or Torrey Pines. Highly recommend this hotel! Our only complaint is that we booked our trip through Expedia and Country Inn & Suites would not let us put the points onto our Club Carlson Account. :( I wish there was a way around that since that was another reason we booked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed Again!”
Reviews.Author: Travelin59
Reviews.Content: The quality of this hotel is impressive. They honored my request to have a room that was quiet by placing me in a room that was on a higher floor and as far away from the elevators as possible. The receptionist also gladly checked us in early even though the hotel was very busy with Spring Break vacationers. In this respect, I was also pleased with how good the breakfast was despite how many people were taking advantage of it. The muffins were warm and excellent. The staff was as friendly as ever, and the cookies are always a big win.

Reviews.Title: “First time at Country Inn and Suites”
Reviews.Author: mike m
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Diego frequently and have an office near this property. I have not been satisfied with other hotels near my office so I tried Country Inn and Suites on Lusk Blvd last week. Wow, what a pleasant surprise. I ahd a very nice spacious room, free wifi, nice bar in which to have a conversation after the work day and a great place to meet colleagues for breakfast in the morning. I dont know what I was expecting from a Country Inn but I was impressed. The staff is first class, the property appears new and looks upscale. This is my new home away from home when I'm in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Surprising find through the many highly rated reviews on TripAdvisor!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBees8
Reviews.Content: I can add my own delighted experience to the many highly raved reviews. For the overall value, this establishment went above and beyond to ensure an enjoyable stay. From the follow-up call by management upon settling into the room to the free cookies in the lobby and the various assortment of the FREE daily breakfast buffet, Country Inn has made it very difficult for myself and my family to stay elsewhere the next time we frequent San Diego, which is pretty often. Thanks CI and keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rokeedy
Reviews.Content: I found a great rate on this suite hotel for my family while visiting San Diego. It is a little out of the way if you want to be more central to the Zoo, Sea World, etc, located in a business district, but the rooms are nice and clean, spacious for families, excellent free breakfast, free Internet and parking, something that is hard to find in hotels around here! heated outdoor pool and great front desk staff. They were out of cribs when I arrived and come bedtime my toddler was running around the room and I was not happy! The staff was very helpful in my moment of desperation and a crib was found! Stay was great, highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: KoYany
Reviews.Content: This hotel even exceeded our expecations! Quiet suburb location, friendly staff, large and comfortable room, excellent breakfast (they even had the porridge that I miss so much when travelling!). Our son enjoyed making the waffles himself! The restaurant in the hotel is very good, and there is also a tex-mex cantina nearby serving great steaks. We really loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive”
Reviews.Author: joy k
Reviews.Content: We Traveled As A family To Celebrate My Birthday.There Were Severeal Things We Loved About This Hotel.Parking Is Free,MyDaughter Loved the bacon,And My Husband Loved The Hot Scrambled Eggs. We Stayed 2 Nights Which Were Wonderful.The Front Desk Always Greeted Me By My Last Name Which Was Very Impressive. It Was A Warm HeartFelt Welcoming. We Plan On Staying Here Again.

Reviews.Title: “I am DEFINITELY staying there again!”
Reviews.Author: Rob B
Reviews.Content: From guest services at sign-in to the morning breakfast and the evening night-cap or dinner this hotel is a real find. The front desk personnel are very helpful, maintenance is quick, services are well beyond what I expected. I was there for business for nearly a month. There were limited exceptions to the superlative experience I had at the hotel - insignificant enough to not merit mention. In fact there are not enough good things I can say about the staff and the facility. I have recommended this hotel to my co-workers, clients, and directors alike.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience in Mira Mesa, would stay here again anytime”
Reviews.Author: vanbigslick
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to cater to sightseeing families looking for value, and to business travelers visiting the local area. It makes for an odd mix of guests. During our stay there were a couple of seminars or courses going on in the meeting areas, so the lobby was typically quite busy. That said, parking was never an issue over the 6 days we were there. The staff were very friendly and helpful whenever we had questions or requests. The weather wasn't the greatest when we were there, so no comment on the pool. Wi-fi was free and generally worked well, although they did have a system issue the morning we left. The location is fairly central to many attractions in the San Diego area. We found that we were about 25 min from Carlsbad/Oceanside, and 15 min from Downtown/Balboa park. 10-15 min to La Jolla. About 5 mins east of the hotel there are a couple of shopping centres with decent restaurant options and places to get provisions. It's close to Miramar, so we often saw and heard military aircraft, although the noise didn't interfere with sleeping at all. The rooms are basic but clean, roomy and comfortable, easily meeting the expectations of the star level of the property. In my opinion, they represent good value. Our room had a small fridge, a microwave, and a mini coffee maker. The breakfast buffet is more than a continental, and the offerings rotated throughout our multi-night stay. There were often eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, etc. There's also a waffle maker that is a high-demand item. The food quality is decent but not fantastic, but seeing as it's included in the stay I thought it was excellent value. They also have a little refreshment stand by the front desk, which was nice to grab a drink or fruit/cookie on the way in or out. *note* - management actively solicits Trip Advisor feedback via email after your stay, even noting that they've targeted you because you have gave good review to their internal survey they send out via multiple emails post-stay. To date I've received 3 separate emails asking for feedback; I find this an unnecessary annoyance to deal with after my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean, and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Paula A
Reviews.Content: Good location for sight seeing in San Diego. Very close to the interstate and just a short drive to all the popular sights. Free parking. Good free breakfast. Clean rooms. And good prices. Just a nice standard hotel for a reasonable price especially if you stay during the weekend when the business men are gone becasue the prices are cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently nice hotel, good value and location”
Reviews.Author: jdieringer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here multiple times when visiting San Diego. It is near La Jolla with easy access to San Diego and only an hour or so to Orange County. The hotel is always clean and well maintained. The rooms are nicely done. The breakfast is always good with a large variety. You can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: ritzglitz99
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for 4 nights and enjoyed our stay very much! Great place to stay for a family with small children. My kids enjoyed the pool and breakfast was EXCELLENT! Great, convenient way to start off each morning. Kids enjoyed the pool! Short drive to USS Midway, Sea World, Torrey Pines State Reserve, San Diego Zoo, La Jolla beach, and Cabrillo National Monument. Traffic was not bad at all when getting to where we were going each day. Great value for our money and so glad we stayed here!

Reviews.Title: “Love Country Inn”
Reviews.Author: Machilus
Reviews.Content: I wanna give a 4.5 review for this hotel, however, trip advisor didn't have this option. This hotel was really nice with a convenient high-tech location. This hotel featured with free parking, space not hard to find, free hot breakfast, truly fantanstic, free internet, but slow. The lobby was warm with a bar, and the front desk was so so at my time checked in. The room was good but hallway had a little smell maybe from the paint. Sleep quality is really good. I minused 0.5 point because the internet. For my second night, the internet was totally down and wouldn't be back until next morning which caused a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Biomedguy
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here at the end of our winter vacation. The front office staff were most helpful (even advising us of the upcoming time change to Daylight Savings). The hotel was spotless, our room very comfortable. And the breakfast included eggs/bacon/sausages, not the usual muffins and toast. We are most pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Anthony T
Reviews.Content: This place is the best value I have ever been in. If your are going to the SanDiego area do your self a favor and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel...perfect for families and business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Sam C
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel for four nights and I was impressed beyond measure. The hotel room was equipped with microwave and refrigerator and the continental breakfast had something for everyone. I'm a stickler for cleanliness andnevada amazed at how clean the entire hotel was maintained. The hotel staff bent over backwards to make our stay memorable---from impeccable housekeeping, fantastic beach suggestions from the front desk, and breakfast staff who were incredibly gracious. The hotel was very quiet though there were many people on site. The dining area had two sections so business travelers could watch the news or conduct breakfast meetings in a quieter location. The location was a central home base as we traveled to Legoland, beaches, and San Diego theme parks. I'd highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value...insufficient closet space...loved the tea and cookies in the evenings”
Reviews.Author: Susylevy
Reviews.Content: Abou a 15 minute drive to SD, this unpretencious high value hotel is woth it. Break fast is good, they make an effort to have some daily variety, but after a week long stay, the scrambled eggs although good, could use an alternative; wait staff is very friendly, as well as front desk personnel. Rooms are spacious and clean, but there is hardle any closet space, my beau and I stayed for a week and I had no place to unpack. There is no noise as the hotel is in a business area with two other hotels next door. They set out cofee and tea all day, granola bars in the morning a yummy cookies in the evening, plus if there was no hot water or coffee the front desk staff would happily and immediadtely bring me some. Parking and breakfast are included, big plus. A safe hotel choice, will look for this brand in the future, congratulations to themanagement and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great family/business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina785
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a nice surprise! I stayed there while taking my young daughter to the SD Zoo. It is in a covenient location. The location was very safe. I love that the rooms have a small fridge and microwave. The breakfast was very good. But the service and small touches put the hotel over the top. As an example, the front desk called me after I got to my room to make sure everything was OK, the maid service did all the little things like leaving new plastic bags every day for the ice bucket, and I was always welcomed into the hotel by the desk staff. My daughter and I stayed at neighboring hotels and tried their free breakfast. County Inns was so much better. The service staff were constantly refilling empty items and cleaning tables so new guests could be seated. It was excellent. I would recommend it for business travel or vacation travel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is absolutely amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Meredith M
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? First off, our rooms were very comfortable. They have queen size beds, huge comforters, working AC, a big bathroom, etc. Second, they have a monsterous spread for breakfast in the morning. It's complimentary, and while they say they close at 9:30, they were still serving at 10:30. They also have an outdoor heated room, many conference rooms, an office room, and the staff is very friendly. They have cookies coffee, and lemon water down in the lobby. I can say with complete honesty, this is the best hotel I've ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Leigh B
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel. Great place to stay for business as it is close to my company's office.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service = Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Hector R
Reviews.Content: We expected the hotel to be clean and with all the amenities of a recognized establishment. The Country Inns and Suites in San Diego exceeded those expectations. However, what really made our stay a great experience was the excellent service provided by John Holmes in the front desk. Mr. Holmes assisted us with a last minute reservation, made sure that our specific needs were met, and that our party was staying in rooms within the proximity of each other. The extra perks of being Club Carlson members added to our experience: room upgrades, welcome kits, free wi-fi, and a complimentary breakfast. I strongly recommend this hotel if you are staying in San Diego. My family and I will be returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mtnbiker2
Reviews.Content: There simply isn't anything negative to report. The room was spotless. The room was quiet. The room was reasonably priced. The breakfast was excellent. Parking was plentiful and free. I left a $5 tip for the housekeeping staff. The location, in a business park dominated by Qualcomm buildings (Qualcomm is a major high-technology company), is not near any major San Diego attractions, but that's OK. Unless it's rush hour, you can be in downtown San Diego, Sea World, La Jolla, or Del Mar in about 20 minutes. You will, however, need a car; I wouldn't try to get there by public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: cuffemdude
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as my base camp for a business trip. Excellent location. About a fifteen minute drive to the airport in San Diego without traffic. Ample parking. Nicely appointed lobby. Friendly front desk staff. Check-in was a breeze. The room was very nice and CLEAN! Plenty of space to spread out. Nice flat screen tv with HBO. Big, comfortable bed. Lots of pillows. Alarm clock/radio. New iron and ironing board. Refrigerator. Lots of outlets for all my rechargers (cell phone, iPad, blue tooth, etc). Great breakfast buffet. Coffee is always available in the lobby. Nothing went wrong. Restaurant and bar open until 10 pm. If you want to eat or drink later, walk across the parking lot to the Chili's restaurant. Would definitely stay here again for business, or pleasure if returning to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Convert to this Property!”
Reviews.Author: RRRyan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed, in many, many Hotels in and around the San Diego area, and I was pleased to find this County Inn. The staff is exceptional. And, that includes all of the Reception, Housekeeping, as well as the Restaurant and Bar personnel at this Best Value, and exceptional Hotel. The location (adjoining the Qualcom headquarters area) in a superb location, allowing one to "dart" in, out and around San Diego and North County. Rooms are well appointed, and exceptionally clean. The breakfast buffet is very well prepared and presented. And, then there are the fresh baked, Otis Spunkmeyer cookies in the reception area at 5PM, as well as complimentary coffee and fresh fruit throughout the day and evening. . The overall hospitality is contiguous.

Reviews.Title: “Country Inns - our new favorite place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Damian M
Reviews.Content: Yeah they have clean, beautiful rooms with comfortable beds and great showers...hotels are SUPPOSED to have that. If someone from the hotel staff smiles at you and asks how you're doing...whoopty-doo, they're SUPPOSED to do that. But when a member of the hotel staff strikes up a conversation with you and has a genuine interest in your life and is willing to share something personal with you about them, THAT leaves a good impression. When MORE THAN ONE staffperson does that, then THAT leaves a GREAT impression, and that's what Country Inns is all about. My wife and I raise our glass particularly to Saeid from the breakfast buffet staff. He genuinely enjoys his job and takes great pride in his job. He and my wife shared a wonderful conversation that completely sold her on making Country Inns our new favorite hotel. Oh and by the way, the buffet was AMAZING! The young man at the front desk "remembered" our room number when we checked out; I mean it's that kind of customer service that goes above and beyond expectations. Country Inns & Suites - Your first time won't be your last time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisVail
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our son's basketball team and other parents. Had a tournament at local schools. Very convenient to the highways needed to get to each game. Breakfast was good, had a nice variety of food, fruit, cereals, waffles, eggs with different sides. Staff was very nice. Rooms were clean. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotels in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: George S
Reviews.Content: Not in downtown, this hotel is more in the business district and offers the best combination of ammenities, price, appearance, guest services and cleanliness. I shopped many others and this hotel also has one of the best rates. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Pincher01
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend and had a great time. Being very familiar with La Jolla and the golden triangle, this location worked well and the price was very reasonable. The included breakfast buffet was among the best we've had and I made sure to tip those guys each day, because the personal attention the servers gave us was worth it. The front desk personnel were very good, especially John. Always greeted us whether coming or going and they were making sure everything was good during our stay. We had a room with 2 queens and it was a good size, similar to just about every hotel we've stayed. But if I could change anything, it would be to have the room be a little larger. When we checked out, we looked at a suite and that had more room so I'll be sure to get that next time when we come back in a month.

Reviews.Title: “Great jumping-off point for the whole San Diego area”
Reviews.Author: davidbh1453
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for our New Years Eve at the La Jolla Playhouse and Roy's. Short drive to La Jolla beach and a bit longer drive to the airport and downtown SD. Perfect jumping off point for north county, but not too onerous to get downtown. Very quiet, excellent service, free parking, and comfortable room that was ready for us early in the day! Delicious full breakfast buffet in the morning, and they gave us a late checkout! We are always pleased at Country Inn & Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: trip_reviewer_2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel offer a good breakfast. Good variety and quality. Staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Worst receptionists I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: Sam A
Reviews.Content: During my 3 days stay, only one out of the 5 receptionist I spoke to was courteous. Very limited in-room dining service. I had to check-in my luggage in their security room or whatever they have to keep guest's bag for sometime. The guy literally dropped my bag inside the room. For the love of god, I had my laptop inside. They advertise free breakfast. Some folks might like it, but I didn't. Options were very limited. Rooms are being renovated. They gave a room that was recently painted and paint smell was horrible. Free cookies were good. Btw, I have never written any reviews so far. But I was so pissed at the receptionists, that I had to write this.

Reviews.Title: “Came highly recommended - and exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel, and even though there are some renovations being carried out, this is a quiet, clean and comfortable place to stay. Every member of staff that I have spoken to - including a maintenance person who quickly and professionally carried out a minor repair - has been courteous, helpful and friendly. I will certainly stay here again next time I am in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - especially the breakfast !”
Reviews.Author: Howard J
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days. The room was very nice. The person running the breakfast area was very efficient. Different menus each day, great coffee. The staff cleared the tables of used dishes. The oatmeal was pre-cooked and tasted just like home. One note, there was not a large selection of donuts or sweet rolls, but the rest was very good !

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: Travelin59
Reviews.Content: I regularly travel on business to San Diego, and Country Inns & Suites has become my favorite choice. The staff are always very pleasant. The breakfast has a lot of options, including yogurt, fruit, traditional oatmeal (which I love!), and great coffee. They also have make-it-yourself waffles which are really good. In the afternoon/evening, they have cookies and coffee/tea available. Another perk is their library that you can check out books from. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Bob V
Reviews.Content: Our 2yr old had an accident on the way to the hotel so we needed to wash his blanket ASAP. We arrived to find that the guest laundry was out of service. However, one of the staff members when out of his way to wash my sons blanket in the hotel laundry and deliver it back to our room before my son went to bed.....excellent customer service! We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet (lots of choices!). We would choose this hotel again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Azdaizy
Reviews.Content: A 2 night stay and thoroughly enjoyable. I stayed in one of their newly remodeled rooms. Very clean, staff was pleasant & helpful. The breakfast was fantastic and had lots of options of hot & cold food. It may be in a business district but you didn't need to go far for plenty of restaurant options. It's also close to I-805 so it makes it easy to get around SD. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel & plan on staying there again when I visit family.

Reviews.Title: “It met our expectations...”
Reviews.Author: chioi1922_2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights as part of our family 3-weeks holiday trip in California. This is our first time staying here. I would say the hotel is meant more for business travellers than holiday travellers as it is situated among business parks and residential areas. The hotel seems just gone through some internal renovation works.. We had two queen-sized beds for our family of 5. The room is clean and nice. Quite roomy.. And I like the office chair that comes with the room. Free wi-fi is fast and easily connected to internet. We like very much the hotel's main lobby decor also. A fire-place in cosy family living room setting, very homely; especially with Xmas trees and other Xmas decoration. Breakfast includes hot meals buffet. We like the waffles. Self-served free coffee and tea are available all day in the reception area. Staff in reception counter are very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately its laundry facility was not available during our stay as the drying machine was faulty. We had to go outside to do our laundry at a place about 12~15 minutes drive away. Strongly recommended if you don't mind to drive out to visit the parks such as Lego Land and Sea World etc.

Reviews.Title: “There is no place like home.”
Reviews.Author: beth c
Reviews.Content: The Country Inn has the best service at any hotel that I have ever been to. Our children play club soccer so we are gone every other weekend. Our team LOVES this hotel chain. Their employees are the best part of the hotel because they take of their customers and therefore the customers want to come back. The breakfast was delicious too!

Reviews.Title: “It was very expensive compared to what they offer”
Reviews.Author: Alan T
Reviews.Content: Pros: very good neighborhood, and the breakfast is amazing and very well organized, spacious room. Cons: the front desk lady was very impolite, she speaks very fast, and doesn't care if you understand or not, and when you ask her to repeat a question, she makes faces. The room is very old fashion, there was an scary noise from the corridor due to old fans and air conditioners. It was very expensive compared to what they offer. If you are for tourism in San Diego it is not well located.

Reviews.Title: “Great efforts, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Tom G
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Country Inn & Suites many times. They are always friendly, have great service, and have excellent facilities. I would reccomend it to anyone that needs to stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice, Friendly Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: DobbinsFamily
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two days in October to visit our daughter at U.C.S.D. About 10 minutes from the gigantic campus, it is also a bit out of the way for anything tourist. Located in a quiet residential/industrial area, the staff was very considerate and a nice buffet breakfast, certainly better than Embassy Suites, is served included. There are make-it-yourself waffles, sausages or bacon, plenty of fruit, bagels, toast, several premium coffees, OJ, etc. We also noticed fresh ice water, several coffees, and cookies available in the lobby much of the time. Given the general area, the prices are very reasonable, and my wife and I agreed that we would stay here again (doesn't happen often). FREE PARKING is a big plus. Carlson Properties (owners of the TGI Fridays restaurant chain) also has a frequent guest program to include their other properties (I believe they also own Radisson Hotels among others). All in all, although not located in the most convenient area, the hotel is an "A" in our book!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel... Can't Wait To Go Back”
Reviews.Author: tltfaas
Reviews.Content: I live in Orange County but I like to escape to San Diego to get away from my very noisy dogs and 24/7 business demands. I found Country Inn & Suites accidentally while looking at Expedia. I've stayed in dozens of hotels in San Diego but this is my favorite. The staff is very friendly without being pesky and I loved the location... it's in a business park so it was quiet, quiet, quiet over the weekend. The price was right and I was given a newly refurbished top floor room. Bed was comfortable, the huge tv was nice and I had no problem doing some work at the provided desk. My only quibble... if I did have one... is that drawer space is lacking for long trips but I'm always happy to live out of my suitcase. Loved the free breakfast and the pool looked nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: V1rotate
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was excellent. From a spotless, newly refurbished bedroom to the very smartly presented staff. Breakfast was very good too - a wide choice available in a very clean dinning room. The pool area was a bit stark and for much of the day in the shade. But the temperature of the main pool was the warmest so far on our trip. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rosalie G
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel through a link to a UCSD family weekend. We reserved the hotel blindly, sight unseen, on the telephone while driving to the university. The hotel reservationist was kind and made sure we had everything we requested. Upon our arrival we were very satisfied with how clean the hotel was. The staff was great and even called us after we arrived in our room to make sure we were happy with the room. The breakfast was an added plus and it was nice to know we didn't have to drive around the city looking for a restaurant. We had a fantastic stay. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Staff is second to none, a smile at every turn.”
Reviews.Author: eofficer
Reviews.Content: From the moment my mom, sister and I walked into the hotel we were greeted with a smile and a warm welcome. This experience was only to be followed up by a very clean and comfortable room that suited all of us. The breakfast room and environment was fantastic, clean, plentiful, and full of variety. The vibe in the room was wonderful and the dining staff was very friendly, no surprise there. The price was right and the location was very convenient to everywhere we needed to be. We would definitely stay again and will recommend to friends and family visiting the area for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sherianh
Reviews.Content: This was my first time visiting the West Coast and was kind of leary about choosing and area since I was unfamiliar. This hotel is in a nice safe location...at least I felt safe. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were rather large. I really enjoyed the breakfast buffet and the selection that was offered. I liked the fact that it was located next to a Chili's restaurant if you didn't want to eat at the hotel. I would definitely stay here again upon my future visits to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton No more!”
Reviews.Author: William H
Reviews.Content: Last minute trip to San Diego, and we had a very late checkin Friday night, the staff was outstanding when we arrived, checkin was maybe 30 seconds, into room and it was outstanding, the bed was over the top. We had just been in San Dog for the July 4th weekend and stayed at the Hilton Resort Mission Bat, and we will never go back the room and staff were at best a ONE. The staff at Country Inn were great, from advice on directions to just being nice, the poor staff member that checked us in the first night was there again at 1030 with a smile. We will be back and thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Nancy_Hubby
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with a recent visit to San Diego and my stay and Country Inn. The staff and Front Desk were very cordial, professional and helpful. The hotel and the room were very clean and modern, and the grounds were safe and well kept. The complimentary breakfast was excellent, and there was always freshly brewed coffee in the lobby. Check in and check out was quick and easy. I had to make some last minute changes to my reservation, which were easily and graciously accomodated. The location is close to I-5, i-805, and I-15 freeways, but far enough away so that you do not get freeway noise. There are plenty of restaurants and stores within a five minute drive. There is a Chili's restaurant right in front of the hotel, but we did not dine there. Downtown San Diego, the Zoo, Airport, Safari Park, and other tourist attractions are within a 20 minute drive. One minor complaint is that the walls are thin, and I could here the guest in the next room snoring. Admittedly, I don't know if the walls were that thin, or if the neighbor had a tremendously loud snore. We stayed in the King Suite, which included a separate living room and a sofa bed that my two daughters slept. That part was great. However, the room description mentioned a kitchenette, which was a bit misleading. The kitchenette consisted of a small refrigerator, very small microwave oven, and a coffee maker. So, don't count on preparing any meals and eating in your room. There is no dining table, plates, glasses or silverware.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: kim01Utah
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful. It was very clean. Very good breakfast provided. Plenty of parking. Very easy access to freeway. Very nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel to family and freinds.”
Reviews.Author: Pamela I
Reviews.Content: We had great three week stay. The hotel staff was very friendly, professional and helpful. We would stay here again and will definately recommend it to our family nd friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, our family will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: TheJFamilyof5
Reviews.Content: We were very please with this location. It was clean inside and out. The carpet in the entire building is in the process of being replaced. We stayed here because of the reviews. We went to San Diego Zoo and Sea World. It was about a 15-20 minute drive to both. Which after staying and reading reviews of other places closer we would do the driving again. It is very easy to get to both (using a GPS). The staff was very nice. We didn't have a single issue. We were to breakfast early our second day. We asked if we could get some muffins to go because of our early flight and they brought them out to us promptly. They even brought out the juice early. This is what we all had the day before. Great service! There is a Chili's w/in walking distance. Literally across the parking lot. Our family will definitely be staying here our next trip to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, affordable”
Reviews.Author: Judy N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend, with our daughter and her family in a room nearby. The rooms were spacious, clean, with comfortable beds. We loved that the air conditioning/heating vents were in the wall, not under a window where frigid air blows across the beds at night. The breakfast buffet was amazing, with lots of choices. Our daughter and family enjoyed the pool/spa and used it frequently. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Also, the rooms were quiet and well insulated. Excellent value for the money. One other plus: Very helpful cancellation policy--only 24 hrs., vs. 72 hrs. at many other hotels!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel find and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: DaveAZ4432
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel close to everything in San Diego and found it at this hotel. This hotel wasn't built yesterday, but it looked extremely well taken care of. The rooms were clean, bedding was very comfortable, and even a nice sized flat screen TV and free Internet access. Their staff was exceptional and very pleasant. I had a small issue with the room and they were right on top of correcting it. The breakfast is a nice serve yourself with a variety for everyone. I would use this hotel again for business or pleasure. It has everything I need.

Reviews.Title: “The only place we stay!”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: The perfect balance of comfort and value. Love the quick access to coastal highway. North to Delmar or south to downtown in a snap. Free parking, free internet, free breakfast...WOW!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: MHST S
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel several times in 2011 for business travel for my group. No one has had a complaint, which is nearly unheard of! To date entire stay has been great overall. Staff is consistently polite and helpful, hotel and rooms have been neat and clean and the food is ample at FREE BREAKFAST! If you do not need to be downtown, this hotel is the one for you! My only suggestion is to add a shuttle (preferably free or low-cost per person) to and from the local airport.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Beds and Delicious Cookies!”
Reviews.Author: NessaRae
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, check in was quick and we were able to grab some fresh cookies. The room appeared clean, although the temperature was a little humid in the room. The beds were incredibly comfortable. However, there were no black out drapes in the room so the light of the morning woke me up pretty early. The free breakfast the next day was a bonus. Overall, the staff here was very accommodating and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible for kids”
Reviews.Author: rebeccaross42
Reviews.Content: We had requested two joined rooms as we were coming with 3 adults and 2 children under the age of two. We also told the hotel that we would need two cribs. When we arrives we were told our rooms did not have a door connecting them but were near one another. Life goes on so we went to the rooms to find one was still being cleaned at 4:20pm. We had come from the east coast and really needed to get the kids to bed. we had to take everything and everyone down stairs to get different rooms, much to the annoyance of the front desk staff. The cribs were not in the first set of rooms so we requested them again. When we arrived at the second set of rooms, one had a crib while the other did not. Upon calling the front desk we were told the hotel was out of cribs. Prior to our arrival we had rented a baby swing and some other gear, the front desk informed is that they has not received any deliveries, after calling the company we rented from, they told us it had been delivered and was in a closet by the front desk. Suddenly the front desk was able to locate the swing, etc. We were told room service began at 5. We called at 5 to get some milk for the kids and no one picked up and we kept being transfered to the front desk. The "resturaunt" only had one person working. The front desk suggested we call back in 15-20 mins. After the long, difficult day we had had, we need to get the kids in bed. We had to make our way back downstairs to get the milk. Clearly not life threatening, but the whole check in experience was a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Place with Best Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: WorldSurfMama
Reviews.Content: We love coming to this place when we travel to San Diego. Right off the 805 makes it easy access to the beach, yet close enough to the downtown attractions. We always use the pool, and LOVE the free breakfast, including everything from scrambled eggs and sausage to oatmeal and waffles. They also have a very convenient free shuttle service to surrounding businesses. Pets are allowed, however for a $75 fee (more than most places). That is our only complaint since we have a dog (which we end up kenneling at the La Jolla PetSmart Pet Hotel just a few miles away.)

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: arrosen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is somewhat outside of downtown San Diego; so if you are planning on going to Sea World, the Convention Center or the Zoo, this may not be the hotel for you. However, if you need to be north of downtown, La Jolla, Del Mar, etc. this hotel is great. The rooms are typical hotel rooms...nothing out of the ordinary...but perfectly adequate and large enough for a family of 5 (with an air mattress). The rooms are very clean and the beds are comfortable. The bathroom is typical and very clean as well. The breakfast has somewhat of a variety, but the quality (especially of the hot foods) is jut OK. Again, not gourmet, but perfect for a family of 5! The pool area is small, but adequate. At least when we were there, there were lots of people at the pool, which I find to be nice. BE AWARE - this hotel is in an area that houses Qualcom and other companies. There are about 10 trillion people that work here, and there seems to be only 1 freeway entrance. If you leave the hotel between 4 and 6 pm, plan accordingly. It can take 30-40 minutes just to go a few miles. I certainly don't hold this against the hotel, but just wanted you to know! All in all, I would definitely stay here again if we were coming to this area of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: LettyTaos
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, this was a great experience and I highly recommend this location. You do need a vehicle, as it is in an out of the way location with only a Chilis restaurant next door (which was also very good). The room was very nice and very comfortable and the hotel staff was friendly and efficient. We stayed here for 3 nights after staying in the Hilton La Jolla Torrey Pines for 4 nights. And for the price savings, I would recommend the Country Inn over the Hilton. The size of the Country Inn room was comprable to the Hilton. The only major differences were the size of the TV screen (which did not matter to us), the large fancy pool and hot tub area, and the plush towels and robes at the Hilton (which you just can't beat) If there is a Country Inn located where you are traveling, you would be wise to check it out! That is exactly what I plan on doing the next time I want a clean comfortable room, delicious complimentary breakfast, free parking and excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible... Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: steeny237
Reviews.Content: This stay was horrible. He had bed bugs... all over. we stayed for 3 nights and on the morning we were leaving we found them all over our bed. I understand they are now spreading rapidly now and are difficult to get rid of but i was most unimpressed with how the situation was handeled after being brough to the supervisors attention. There was little compassion for the fact we had been sleeping with bugs and we were only slightly compensated. The supervisor made comments such as "we dont breed them, they are everywhere, and that it was due to foreighners"... so unprofessional. everything else was great however.. the food was great and staff very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location to see many sights in San Diego area.”
Reviews.Author: Ybucs
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. Great, plentiful breakfast buffet, friendly service and comfy rooms. Location is not good if you're interested in downtown, but we visited many areas, beaches, hiking trails and downtown easily.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: pwd60
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here on a family vacation. Very nice and clean hotel. Great breakfast, nice staff. Highly recommend this hotel. Rooms were nice and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property, excellent staff, nice accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: corkster2
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this property, the staff was so helpful. Breakfast was really good & a variety each day. Nice pool. Rooms very clean & comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: mtkrueger_9
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay with this hotel. We booked early and secured a great rate. When we arrived we were allowed to check in early and towards the end of our stay we were allowed to extend our stay at the same rate. The hotel was very quiet even though it was very busy. The hotel staff was very pleasant and accommodating. The hot breakfast included in your price was the best I have ever seen. So many choices every morning from eggs and bacon to waffles to cereal to fresh fruit (cut up or whole for you to take with you) to yogurt to bagels, muffins, and toast. And I could go on. The hotel also had coffee, tea, and a snack out, so we were surprised with granola bars on our way out after breakfast and cookies on our way in! The hotel has a pool, hot tub, fitness center, laundry facility, and computers and printers for guest use, as well as other services we didn't even use. Although it may seem to far from San Diego, it was a very quick drive to all the big attractions from southern San Diego to Legoland and everything in between. The only thing I would say the hotel could improve on was the towels, but with that said, I wouldn't hesitate to book again and we stayed for 9 nights! Definately worth your money!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel! Breakfast is really good.”
Reviews.Author: nicoledenise
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed at this hotel 4-5 different times and love it every time we go. This is our go-to hotel whenever we come down to San Diego. The price is always in our budget and it is located in such a convenient spot next to the freeway (805 & 15) and it's also close to attractions such as San Diego Zoo, San Diego Safari Park, Birch Aquarium, Downtown Gaslamp District, Coronado and various shopping centers/malls. There is FREE parking, FREE breakfast every morning and FREE wifi. And if you're ever feeling hungry but don't want to drive there is a Chili's next door! THE HOTEL: Like I mentioned above there is FREE parking and there is a lot of it! The outside of the hotel could get a paint job but nothing serious. The lobby is nice and the staff is nice and friendly. THE ROOM: The beds are SO COMFORTABLE!!! We've stayed in a regular king room (I believe it's called the Deluxe King) and have stayed in the King 1 bedroom suite. Both are really nice! The deluxe king room has a super comfortable bed, nice sized flat screen, desk, desk chair and an armchair. The dresser has a mini fridge and a microwave and there's also a coffee maker. The bathroom is pretty nice too...there is a timed heater lamp in there! The 1 bedroom king suite is nice too. There is a separate living area with a queen pull out sofa. There is an armchair, desk, flat screen tv, mini fridge, microwave and coffeemaker. The bedroom has the king bed (again super comfortable), dresser, flat screen and another armchair. The bathroom is the same. FREE WIFI!! FREE BREAKFAST: Their breakfast is so good!!!! The food they have ranges from day to day but they usually have eggs, cereal, DIY waffles, coffee, water and juice. They've also had hash browns, country potatoes and corn beef hash. The breakfast alone was enough to make us come back. All in all it is a great hotel and we will continue to book rooms here when we come to San Diego. The only bad experience we had was our last visit when a high school basketball and soccer team was also staying there, most of them stayed on the floor we stayed on and were really loud and it was quite annoying. One night they had the whole team and their chaperons down at the pool for 3+ hours, when they finally left we went down to use the jacuzzi and they left paper plates, half eaten pizzas and candy wrappers on the ground.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kayjen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great from the time we stepped into the hotel. The hotel clerks were courteous, the room was clean and spacious, the breakfast (favorite part) was a great way to start the day. We took a lot at the fitness center although we didn't use the equipment. A variety of machines to exercise with, bottled water available, scale, and very clean. The pool was very nice -- great for families with children!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain with Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: duaneby
Reviews.Content: I had a one-day business commitment in the area so decided to stretch out the stay a few days and take my wife along. While not solely price shopping, we ran across Country Inns & Suites and realized that for a 1-BR suite, this was a heck of a deal(!) including free internet, free breakfast (better than many restaurants), and centrally located to the things we planned to do. We had stayed in one of Carlson's CI&S's in the Minneaplis area a few months ago and they treated us very well so this seemed like the right place. What we couldn't have known from Expedia was the "service first" attitude of the entire complex. From the desk clerks to the housekeeping staff to the breakfast team . . . everyone was bent on making us feel welcome. We had a loose connection on our main TV and within 3 minutes someone was by to fix it. He too was extremely up-beat and pleasant. That really sets the tone for the rest of what happens on your trip, and this trip was one of our best ever. We would highly recommend Country Inns & Suites if the location fits your plans -- they are a few miles away from any major hub of shopping/restaurants, etc. but that makes for a very quiet stay with a safe environment.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, lovely facility and we've found a new place to stay in San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: Superflyjenn
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my two children and had a wonderful time! It was a great place to grab breakfast in the morning, the hotel was clean, our room was quiet, there was no traffic noise, and it was a short 10 minute drive to La Jolla Beach where we saw seals at sunset. I found the hotel online literally less than 24 hours before our trip and it was a perfect place to enjoy 4th of July weekend. Close to beaches, about a 25 min drive to Legoland and relatively close to other Southern CA attractions but without the trappings of being so close to the busy parks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ricardoarjona21
Reviews.Content: We'll definitely be back. Friendly staff and very well kept facilities. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here, convenient location, like the hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaydee1325
Reviews.Content: We are always taken care of from the time we make reservations until we leave. Has a decent breakfast, not real great, but decent. Beds are comfortable, rooms are quiet and great location to several freeways.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great free breakfast, friendly staff, heated pool!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingIsFun01
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Country Inn! The hotel is clean and well kept, the heated pool and hot tub was great, the staff was very friendly and accommodating, and the free breakfast was awesome! Breakfast included hot items: scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, hash browns/potatoes, oatmeal as well as the traditional cereal, yogurt, breads and muffins and a make your own waffle station. Delicious! There's a Chiili's restaurant in the same parking lot, so we ordered dinner to go and ate by the pool. Nice! The fitness center is small, but adequate for a quick workout. The hotel is not in the center of they city, but not far from downtown, La Jolla, etc. And it's a bit north, so it's closer to Legoland. We'd stay there again! Free internet and free parking! (You can't get free parking in the downtown hotels. They average about $20 per night!) The only negative was the roll-in shower in our room made a big water mess in the bathroom floor. Nothing we couldn't deal with. I recommend this hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: amc056
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time staying at the Country Inn and Suites in San Diego. the customer service and amenities was wonderful. The check in and check out process worked like a charm. the breakfast was hot or cold depending on what you wanted and it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Best Breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: webhansen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our little ones and thoroughly enjoyed the included breakfast - worth half the nightly rate alone to be able to fill up our kids before heading to Sea World. We also enjoyed the pool, even at 8am. It was warm and clean and the kids didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Business class at a coach price”
Reviews.Author: SkruffyJew
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped into this hotel I felt like I was at home. Fresher baked chocolate chip cookies, gluteen free breakfast items, EVERYONE spoke english, the room was big, and spacious and beautiful and quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Great base in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: BiztravelguyBoston
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Country Inns and Suites. The location was easy to find, on Mira Mesa just off the 805. Downtown is about 20- 30 minutes depending on traffic and if you take the trolley system (tip - park at Old Town Transit Center for free, hop on the inexpensive trolley for the 10 minute ride downtown). Very friendly staff, spacious rooms, comfortable beds, good prices (for San Diego), free parking. Outstanding breakfast selection (free), internet free but slow connections at times. The whole time I was there, I got the feeling that the staff was genuinely happy to see their customers, and intent on making sure everyone was taken care of. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: gknish
Reviews.Content: I come to SD for business about every 1-2 months. I've stayed at many different hotels in the Sorrento Valley area (close to where I work). This is the best. Rooms are always clean, beds are comfortable, wireless internet actually works, and the breakfast buffet is great. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: raidertrh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our two boys, stayed here over the Memorial Day weekend so our youngest could participate in a local "TopGun" soccer tournament. The rooms and public areas were clean and very nice. Our beds were comfortable with a selection of soft to firm pillows to choose from. The flat screen TV was good sized and added to our enjoyment of downtime in the room. We were very pleased with the variety of items in the free breakfast each morning. It had a good selection hot foods, including the very popular, make-your-own waffle bar. Also, hot and cold cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, bagels, coffee, tea and juices. Our boys spent a lot of time in the pool and Jacuzzi while we enjoyed the lounges around the pool. Parking was right outside the front lobby and the free WiFi was nice, too. We even used the onsite washer/dryer to clean our son's soccer clothes each night. We'll definitely be back there for next year's tournament.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelinsider
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights while visiting San Diego. Front Office staff and help in eating area were great. Room cleaning left a little to be desired. Nice area, but not necessarily for leisure travelers...many businesses in the area, so convenient for that. Hotel lobby is nice with a bar, something I had not seen in a Country Inn before. Room was a little drab and will be in need of updating soon. Our particular room had a view of a large AC unit, wasn't very pleasant, but the price was pretty good. Small refrigerator in the room wasn't very cool.

Reviews.Title: “This great hotel facility and staff that made the stay exceptional”
Reviews.Author: marklitecky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a great anniversary weekend. The hotel staff was great and obviously concerned with making sure we had everything we needed. The breakfast was great, the breakfast room was clean and the staff was very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have stayed in a long time. Great Beds!”
Reviews.Author: dbkopp
Reviews.Content: We came as a group UW Whtewater Mens Rugby Team for the rugby tournament. We had a excellent time. The staff went out of their way to be so accomodating at all times. They even helped with planning a quick dinner for the team and the parents who went on the trip. I would recommend this hotel anytime it is out of the way (in a Corporate Business Park) and quite. The pool and hot tub were so clean and well maintenanced and the work out room helped the guys warm up a bit. Thanks for the great service!!!

Reviews.Title: “They upgraded our room to a suite....how sweet!”
Reviews.Author: Groucho44
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with how professional their young staff at the front desk was. . Clean, spacious room, wonderful breakfast. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss out on the AWESOME breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: christinashelby
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel once before, back in December of 2007, for a full week, and loved it enough to come back this time. We were in town for the Relay for Life Cancer Walk at Lake Poway, and this location was perfect for both that, and for the San Diego SeaWorld trip we'd taken years before. This time, we were able to take advantage of the morning breakfasts and were AMAZED and how thorough and on-the-ball the staff was at replenishing a WIDE variety of scrumptious choices. The eggs were delicious, and we had bacon one morning, and sausage the next. Also pancakes, waffles, very delicious fruit, and even oatmeal, which my husband loves! They even put out brown sugar and other toppings for the oatmeal. The breakfast was over the top for us! Have already recommended to family/friends, and would to anyone else. I get the impression that this hotel services more business travellers than anything else, but during both our stays, we had leisure groups there as well, so it seemed perfect for anyone. Maybe the business people are the reason for the awesome breakfast?? Something else that I particularly enjoy about the Country Inns brand is that both times I've filled out the survey after our stay was finished, I've received personal notes from the hotel manager answering questions, and thanking me for taking the time to complete the survey. First survey was for Country Inn & Suites in Topeka, KS. 2nd survey was for the San Diego Country Inn on Lusk.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: pedroamigo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nites with my wife and young son in March 2011. The hotel is located in a nice green business area which felt very safe and was very convenient to get to. It is only a short drive from the beautiful beach at La Jolla and downtown San Diego is not too far away. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite, which was well appointed with free internet and a comfortable bed. I really liked the complimentary coffee/tea and iced water with orange slices that they served all day in the lobby. Also amazing were the complimentary freshly baked cookies served every evening - they were the best complimentary cookies I've had in any hotel. The hotel serves a complimentary full breakfast in the morning, with a good selection of hot and cold items. We loved the self-make waffles which were served with an excellent strawberry dressing. It was also a nice touch to have breakfast with real silver cutlery and porcelain plates. And finally the staff. Very friendly and polite front desk personnel and the housekeeping and maintenance staff had ready smiles. I usually stay at Holiday Inn Express when we go on holidays and I am a Priority Club Platinum Elite member. However, now that I have been introduced to Country Inn & Suites, I will look for this brand whenever we travel. It is just way better! Well done Country Inn & Suites San Diego -please do keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “standard mid-range hotel - could use some updating ; breakfast was so-so”
Reviews.Author: DavidLau
Reviews.Content: The room itself was pretty large. Comfortable king-size bed. Desk in one corner - free wifi. The bathroom has marble counter top and is of standard size. There's a flat panel TV with ~80 analog cable channels - not one HD channel - come on, it's 2011. While everything was clean it could have used some refreshing of the decor & furniture. The free breakfast buffet had hot items - scrambled eggs, either bacon or sausage & waffle or pancake. It was OK but nothing spectacular. We did have dinner at the hotel one night and I do have to say that dinner was good - not fancy but the portions & quality were good. There's a computer room with 2 computers with wide-screen LCDs - each with its owner printer. Very useful. All in all, a very good deal for the price, but its still a somewhat cookie-cutter experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great first time at a Country Inn&Suites”
Reviews.Author: zebov
Reviews.Content: Check-in attendant was very cordial. Rooms was huge and more luxurious than I had anticipated. Breakfast was astounding for being a free "continental" (belgian waffles were delightful). I utilized their free business center to print off some things and it worked out well. They even have a small free book library where they let you take a book with you after you check out so long as you bring it back the next time you stay at a Country Inn & Suites (no doubt they do this to entice you to return, but I think it's a win-win gesture). Only down side was the internet was quite slow. All-in-all I was very impressed and wouldn't hesitate to stay and a Country Inn & Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “All around 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: BurkeVaTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is classified as a 3 star and I understand why based amenities but I give it 4 stars for a rating. Our room was basic but spacious and clean. We loved the breakfast the fitness room and the pool. Not luxury but not far from it. Nice staff too. We got our room on Priceline very cheap ($50/night!) well worth it. :)

Reviews.Title: “Didn't know what to expect but was surprised”
Reviews.Author: BoiseID999
Reviews.Content: We came to town with a team for a soccer tournament. Large, comfortable rooms. Beds very comfortable. Great service from front desk. Staff let us bring in our own dinner and use dinning area with no problems. Only downer was pillows too soft, you need 3 to equal one. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru7718
Reviews.Content: Staff was VERY helpful and friendly. Hotel is not downtown SanDiego, but not too far either. More of an economy type hotel, but breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: seahorse5555
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay!! The hotel is beautiful and the staff was wonderful! My husband and I stayed there for the park and cruise option. We were on our Honeymoon. The price was good. The lady that drove the shuttle was there on time to take us and she was there on time to bring us back. She was so nice and Hilarious! We stayed in a suite the room was pretty The breakfast was delicious! I would recommend this hotel. We were 1/2 mile from our port. This was very convient for us.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Friendly with lots of greenery”
Reviews.Author: casabear
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Everyone was so friendly. Every one said "Good morning" as I passed by - housekeeping, maintenance, other staff. The suite was a good size and had a mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The bed was firm and lots of pillows were on the bed. The sheets and towels were bright white and smelled clean. The air conditioning worked great and I had a nice view of the pool. The walls were a little thin, and it was hard to get used to the slamming doors but I suppose that's just the way it is at a hotel. The breakfast was terriffic - bacon, eggs, hasbrowns, waffels, bagels, yogurt, oatmeal, and juice. The pool was nice looking and inviting, although I did not try it out. I enjoyed going for walks around the area, there were a lot of trees and flowers. I definately would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: AZHeat200
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before, a couple of years ago. Summer is the peak season for San Diego so hotels are higher priced, but we got this 2 queen room for $134 per night plus we paid an extra $5 upgrade for the top 7th floor room. It had a good view. This hotel is a little north of downtown SD , but not too far from everything if you have a car. The parking is free and has room to park a pickup. Something hard to come by in SD. We stayed 4 nights and the free breakfast was good. Plenty to choose from: scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, different potato each day, make your own waffles, french toast, oat meal, cold cereals, breads yogert, fruit, juice, coffee. Cookies in the evening & always coffee. There's an evening bar and light room service meals. A Chili's in the parking lot. Good selection of restaurants & shopping on east Mira Mesa Blvd. Room was clean and a good size. Thermostat for AC/heat worked well. The beds were quality but a little too firm for me. Free internet worked well for our laptop, alittle slow for video streaming. This is a good hotel. You can't go wrong. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Devil94
Reviews.Content: Good location, but ... AC did not work in room, sofa sleeper had dirty incomplete bedding, never any pool towels, and restaurants in area close early do to functioning primarily as lunch outlets for area businesses

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior2K
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed six nights in a 2-queen room while on vacation in Southern California. We have no complaints. The front desk, breakfast, and lounge employees were helpful and accommodating. The room was clean, roomy, and quiet. We slept great. This Country Inn, like all the others that I've stayed at across the country, offers a solid value. The location worked well for us as we wanted to enjoy the north San Diego beaches and city without the hassle of downtown congestion and parking. It also made our day trip to Los Angeles easier. The breakfast was exceptional. The daily selections included eggs, sausage or bacon, potatoes, french toast, waffles, muffins, toast, yogurt, cereals, juices, and many other choices. The dining area was kept extremely orderly and fully stocked. The hotel has a nice pool, landscaping and grounds, and plenty of parking. There is a Chili's restaurant next door and all the other common franchises within 4-5 miles. This hotel will be our first choice if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs in room 532”
Reviews.Author: yardov
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I had bed bugs in the hotel. They got spread to my appartment back home and I'm just about to get completely rid from them. I'm passing the word to anyone I know from Qualcomm and other companies not to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel and Staff there is.”
Reviews.Author: navygirlblue
Reviews.Content: We reserved the hotel online with CI as were are goldoint holders. They hotel was so much more than we thought we were getting. Upon arrival the lady at the front desk was great. We requested to extend the reservation by two days and she gave us a great rate. The hotel gave the dogs their own toys, bones, and doggie trash bags. The room was spacious and it was not outdated. The room did not come with a frig or a microwave so we requested one and told it would be free of charge even through it was 70.00 for each the entire stay. Then the breakfast was amazing. The food changed on a daily basis. They had eggs, biscuits and gravy, cereal, oatmeal, waffles, etc. It was worth at least a 50.00 breakfast to a family of 4. The pool and hot tub were heated and great. The business center was in the process of being re done so the desk allowed me to use their computer when I needed it until the new business center was open, We stayed there for 7 days and the hotel staff even knew us by name and noticed us when we came and went throughout the stay. Could not ask for a better hotel. Wish more were like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Value !”
Reviews.Author: tchefuncta
Reviews.Content: We visited friends in Palm Desert after a cruise and needed a place to stay before catching our flight home the next day. Chose this hotel because it was near, but not adjacent to the airport. Pricelined it for a friday night for only $44. The front desk graciously checked us in @ 11:30AM (way ahead of the 3PM check-in). I wanted to avoid checking in with a Priceline voucher @ 10:30PM after coming back from the desert. The lobby area and lounge were very attractive and the breakfast dining room was larger and nicer than I expected. The single-king room was large and very clean. Breakfast in the morning was hot, very ample, and free. There was a Chili's next door as well as on site dining. This hotel doesn't seem to be near any particular tourist attraction, but if you have a car that wouldn't be a show stopper. We will definitely look for Country Inns for our future travel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Rooms a little dated. Good value overall...”
Reviews.Author: CimcoTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights in January. This hotel was very clean overall and the service was good. The furniture and decor in the rooms were somewhat dated. Complimentary breakfast was on par with that of a Hilton Garden Inn, except that it was free! Would recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for its class - could not have chosen better”
Reviews.Author: otrx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a day of driving and relaxing at the beach, visited San Diego downtown in the evening. The location is rather good - 2 minutes from the interstate and therefore comparably quick to SD as well as the beach. Obviously, the hotel not being either directly at the beach or in SD downtown contributes to the reasonable rate (we paid $65). Finding the hotel is easy, it is surrounded by other hotels, at least one chain restaurant and business centers. Parking s easy, check in might have been the speediest ever. The rooms are of a very good size, nicely appointed and clean. The same goes for the bathroom, which left a very good impression. There was an AC unit outside our window which came to life every once in a while and rustled for a few minutes, but otherwise it was very quiet. The free WiFi worked great. We had a very good night's sleep and woke up to a great breakfast, including several hot dishes and do-it-yourself waffles. Check out was as quick as check in. We had forgotten a laptop charger at the hotel and I called them to days after - I was not actually expecting much of a chance since often hotels are not overly interested in helping in these matters and was very surprised by the positive reactions of the staff - they called me back as promised, found the charger and shipped it. Very nice and unexpected - a big thumbs up! Positive: - Room (esp. bathroom) I would not have expected - they simply lacked the 'cheapishness' often found in non-luxury chain hotels. We felt very comfortable and had none of the "better not touch that" feelings one often encounters. - Breakfast - this was an actual breakfast and a good start in the day. - Staff and Service: Every encounter was very friendly and helpful. - Free parking, Wireless and breakfast. Negative: - Cannot find anything negative that would be worth pointing out - obviously it is not a 5 star property, but a very nice and clean 3 star hotel. Recommendation: This is the best hotel of its class/price range I have seen in a while. I would absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Where mattresses go to die......”
Reviews.Author: djoiler
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel with one exception. This hotel, bar none, has the worst mattresses since the invention of the mattress. Truly where all other mattresses go to die when they are done. No other complaints. I won't comment on the large man doing his impression of a vacuum cleaner at the front desk eating the last SEVEN cookies while the front desk staff looked on in awe.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay with free breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: lslovbabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night the night before our cruise. It was great! The best part was the free breakfast downstairs in the morning. I will definitely go there again. I paid $60 for the room on priceline. I will definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever, Best Staff Ever!”
Reviews.Author: iluvgr8tdeals
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel when our receptionist at the Residence Inn at La Jolla Dr. did not honor our reservation when he claimed that our reservation had been made using the Marriott chain, and Marriott was 'not a sister hotel'. We had checked out of a Vegas hotel of the same chain and did a phone check-in during the day at La Jolla, expecting the keys at 4.00am! We craftily asked the rude guy at The Residence Inn whether we could check 'something on the computer', and we quickly booked our room at the Country Inn. We drove to the Country Inn, and a world of difference unravelled before our eyes! Ryan, the front desk staff was sympathetic to our plight, and promised to have a cleaning staff to prepare the first available room (it had been sold out) once the first guest checked out. 5 minutes later, a room had been found after a guest checked out early, and in we went. I have been to many hotels, and I try to leave positive reviews where I can; the staff at Country Inn and Suites were excellent! They went out of their way to make sure that we were comfortable and had a room to sleep, despite our last-minute booking! The room was nice, the breakfast had a lot of variety. It was very family oriented, lots of small kids around at breakfast, a good thing if families (the pettiest of them all) can make bookings here! It was fully booked, meaning that they were doing something right. It had internet in the rooms, and a free computer downstairs. It had a wonderful lobby, a pool, etc. You probably need a car, as it is 15-20 minutes away from downtown ( I saw a shuttle service van, so please ask), but it is about 3-4 minutes from the I-805 freeway. The lady at the reception Sunday night allowed me to make a phone call when she realized that my cell-phone was out of charge, which I considered out of the ordinary! I could go on and on, but my International Rugby Sevens experience became so much nicer after the fantabulous service from Ryan and Co!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money, but...”
Reviews.Author: Nicilovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Was good value for money, cheaper than all the other suite hotels in the area. I liked the king bed suite, enough space for two parents, one toddler and one baby. Not completely new but ok. They didnt clean the first day, ok, I was only two hours away, maybe they missed this time gap. But the didnt clean the second day either, where we were away for 6 hours. My husband talked to the cleaning ladies and they said, well, there was so many stuff laying on the floor. Hello? Of course, my little son leaves his toys on the floor. And we have two strollers. And a lot of stuff traveling with two little ones. Is this a reason for not cleaning the room? At least they could have changed the towels. Then my husband complained at the reception and they were very sorry and offered a free dinner for the whole family or extra goldpoints. We took the goldpoints and figured it a good compensation. The breakfast was good for the price of the hotel, really good orange juice, waffles, scrambled eggs and so on. The airconditioning is very good which I liked espacially, since fresh air is very important to me and you cant open the windows in this hotel. At the right price I would return!

Reviews.Title: “This place used to be good”
Reviews.Author: Traveler075
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times and it has gone downhill. The rooms are getting shabby and half the equipment in the exercise room is broken.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: travelerAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: Stayed for an extended period and got a fantastic rate on priceline. Free parking, free wifi, free full breakfast 7 days a week were all bonuses. Located close to highways and rooms were adequate. Would definitely stay here again. My husband loved the belgian waffles at breakfast but there were also eggs, bacon, sausage, yogurt, cereal, bagels, danishes, etc. The overall value was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal...........”
Reviews.Author: peachesWoodbury_MN
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific stay at this hotel. First booked because the rates were 40% off for a 4 night stay. The stay was great from the moment we arrived. We were upgraded to a suite - which was a first for us in all our travels. The 'free' breakfast was more than we imagined. Hot scrambled eggs, ham, bacon & sausage (1 meat item each morning) along with the waffles, bagels, toast , juice even offered skim milk. Very friendly staff. Very conveniently located. Can't say enough. If we ever venture out to San Diego this will be our 1st choice.

Reviews.Title: “good San Diego deal”
Reviews.Author: socalsweethearts
Reviews.Content: Pros: great price via priceline; very good breakfast; free parking; free internet access; large king room; nice fitness equipment; helpful staff; quiet location; good work/desk chair; USA Today and Wall Street journal Cons: spotty wireless internet, no wired internet; limited TV channel selection; older (though large) TVs For a business traveler, the inconsistent wifi in the rooms could be a pain. Otherwise this was a nice hotel at a fantastic price via priceline. Many S.D. hotels charge for parking, internet, breakfast, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: secretagentangie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location (right off the 805) and was close to all of the people that I wanted to visit and see. The room was better than I had expected, and I am thoroughly pleased with my experience there. I'm certain that if I had been from out of town (meaning not from Southern California), I would have loved the convenience and location! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY CUPS...Pictures included”
Reviews.Author: ErythAngel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 19 - 21 Sept. Friday night, I washed the coffee cups they provided for us in the bathroom sink. Saturday morning, I marked the bottoms of the cups with eyeliner and left traces of coffee in them. It was obvious these cups were dirty. There are cards that you are supposed to place on your beds to indicate whether or not you want them to be made. You are also encouraged to put your towels on the floor if they need replaced. We made sure the cards were on the beds and the towels were on the racks. When we returned Saturday night, there were clean towels and semi-made beds (the sheets and blankets were haphazardly thrown over the mattress).
